channel.title: Java.awt.headlessexception
channel.description:
[code] lewkserv@V0912134PQ84Y-1:~/1$ java Server Exception in thread "main" java.awt.HeadlessException: No X11 DISPLAY variable was set, but this program performed an operation which requires it. at java.applet.Applet.<init>(Applet.java:67) at Server.<init>(Server.java:30) at Server.main(Server.java:34) [/code]
I know it has something to do with my X11 display driver, but I'm using ssh linux terminal. so, lolwut? I've tried setting the argument java.awt.headless=true, also I've googled it and it says that the JBDC driver has something to do with it, I've looked through my classes and I've commented it out all of the references to JBDC. Still nothing.

item.title: Java.awt.headlessexception
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:5, topic:333059”]ok, try entering

export DISPLAY=:0.0

into bash, i tried it on my ubuntu box and does not say I need to be root.[/quote]
Thanks, that worked. I was thinking something completely different.

Read full topic

item.title: Java.awt.headlessexception

item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:2, topic:333059”] DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY

put it in your .bash_profile[/quote]
I don’t have access to that as I’m not ROOT nor do I have access to ROOT.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

DISPLAY=:0.0
export DISPLAY

put it in your .bash_profile

item.title: Java.awt.headlessexception
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

lewkserv@V0912134PQ84Y-1:~/1$ java Server
Exception in thread "main" java.awt.HeadlessException:
No X11 DISPLAY variable was set, but this program performed an operation which requires it.
        at java.applet.Applet.<init>(Applet.java:67)
        at Server.<init>(Server.java:30)
        at Server.main(Server.java:34)

I know it has something to do with my X11 display driver, but I’m using ssh linux terminal.
so, lolwut? I’ve tried setting the argument java.awt.headless=true, also I’ve googled it
and it says that the JBDC driver has something to do with it, I’ve looked through my classes and I’ve commented it out all of the references to JBDC. Still nothing.

Read full topic
